review_title: Good place to start your career
pros: Nice work environment and convenience for a student
cons: Low pay for the work given

review_title: Excellent Professional Environment, Wonderful Colleagues and Educational Amenities - Highly Recommended!
pros: Undoubtedly, Mohawk is one of the best educational institutions I've worked for over the span of my +5 year career in Higher Education so far. I'm a part of a wonderful team, have interacted deeply with some of the most amazing colleagues, and I receive numerous professional opportunities to expand upon my professional repertoire by taking on numerous challenges in the form of different projects and events within the broader scope of my current role. I'm really happy with the way my role is panning out so far and I would love to remain a part of this team as long as I can!
cons: I'm currently still employed as a part-time, contract employee and would love to be able to find an opportunity that is permanent.

review_title: Mohawk College is a really good employer
pros: Lots of opportunities to learn and grow.
cons: Really no cons to speak of - if you work hard and do well then you will be recognized for that and feel appreciated

pros: Great team of people to share a work day with
cons: Not a great organizational structure

pros: Pay can be good if you include health benefits and pension.
cons: Pay isn't good and has been stagnant for years.

review_title: Good benefits, Secure position, Difficult to be a full-time, Slow change
job_title: Information Management Specialist in Hamilton, ON
pros:
The company provides good benefits such as insurance, financial support for education, and pension.

Once you become full-time, it's very secure and lots of people stay in the position for many years.
cons:
It's difficult to get a full-time position or become one.

The company is slow on changes. Many systems are old or outdated compares to the market.

review_title: Decent place to work, extremely laid back to the point you fall off the chair
pros:
Good decent people, pension, good pay
Take any night course for 20 bucks
A lot of problems to solve. ... if you want to, or not.
cons:
Not a lot of mentors with ambition or good work ethic
Not a good balance of goal setting
Too laid back - a 2 week project stretched to 6 months with no accountability
Food there is meh, $$, and unhealthy
Had a manager that literally did zero, in a handoff gave zero, rudely left halfway through the meeting and went to another job, he was getting 20k more and was the same age as me, and I worked hard.

pros: Great environment. Coordinators, Associate Deans, Professors and Support staff are all helpful. They respond quickly and ensure faculty have everything they need to teach.
cons: The only con is that now that the courses are back in person, I am unable to continue to work with them.

review_title: Poor onboarding support for Sessional Instructors
job_title: Instructor, Graphic Design in Hamilton, ON
pros: Great classroom technology and eager students
cons: Sessional pay per hour is for classroom time only and (at least the courses I was given to teach) it doesn't begin to cover time required to develop lessons, teach and mark assignments. Compared to another college I taught at, the class sizes were double and therefore the workload was higher although the class time was shorter. Ended up earning less than minimum wage. No thanks.

review_title: Good for students to work and study
pros: flexibility at work schedule. Opportunity to communicate with tutees
cons: wages are changed based on tutoring appointments.

pros: teaching the students was the best and most satisfying experience it was a pleasure to see them graduate.
cons:
no promotion the PRT and and Aviation Dean will not do anything unless it is of monetary benefit to them. When full time positions come up the positions are given to people with little or no teaching experience instead of the part time/partial load instructors that have been teaching for years. The management is very 2 faced and tells the part time instructors one thing to get the instructors to stay and then goes and does the opposite. They are very untrustworthy and theft is also a problem which has been hidden from the Dean by the present PRT mainly because he was the culprit. Instructors have left quit because of the total disorganization and dishonesty of the upper management.
Courses instead of having one instructor for everything have 4/5 instructors which does not contribute to any continuous teaching standard so each class gets taught differently and usually by someone who has never had anything to do with Aviation. They also push students through whether they pass or not doctoring marks is very common by the management.

review_title: Software Developer - iDeaWorks Medic - A place to start, but move on after a few years
pros: As an initial start to gaining entry into the workforce it's good from the aspect of work experience. The  co-workers are friendly and helpful, flexible hours for start and end times.
cons: Management spends more time talking about how great they are and less time actually doing and following up, FT employees aren't helpful and trying to gain knowledge/help from them is a lost cause. Project management is a big issue, everyone is technically focused and there's no one to oversee the projects or deal with toxic client's. Responsibility falls on the developers to manage clients. Very difficult to execute what management demands are without support.

review_title: Generally a good place to work, but can be slow moving and bureaucratic.
pros: Stable union position, with great benefits, decent pension, education benefits, fair working hours no excessive overtime, extra week of over Christmas. Nice modernized campus.
cons: Employer can be frustratingly slow moving and bureaucratic, probably many educational institutions are like this, but compared to private industry this can be quite frustrating. Suburban campus is modern, and has been nicely updated, but is a bit of a commute if you use transit, and far from good restaurants etc. for lunch, you'll have to brown bag it or eat at the campus cafeterias.

review_title: Able to teach in an area that I love.
pros: It is a well respected college recently finishing at the top of a KPI survey in student satisfaction. Great staff including co-workers and support staff. Close relationship to other teaching areas within our department. It allows me to set up my own curriculum. Good on-line platforms to teach some content from. It is a quick commute from home.
cons: Working Part-time in Continuing Education is the worst pay rate that you can receive at this school. In additional, the pay rate is only for the hours in class; i.e., no payment for class prep, creating /grading tests assignments, answering e-mails etc. And there has been no raise in this faculty for approximately 8 years.... yes; eight.

review_title: If it weren't for my team, I'd not have stayed as long as I did
pros: It was all about my team. I had a super high functioning team. If you get a good team, you can avoid the overwhelming political bologna. Often, you will see people who shouldn't be promoted (underqualified), promoted to very high paying jobs. HR can be a bit of a shark-nado, but that seems to be a common trend in HR.
cons: The CIO at the time was a total toolbox; an Apple bro who wanted to "i-ify" everything. Thankfully, he has since been canned.

review_title: don't let them string you along
pros:
Good pension (when you get there)
Good benefits (when you get there)
Nice campus/facilities
cons: The College likes to hire people as part time, or on one year and two year contracts and string you along in the hope that you'll get one of the amazing permanent full time roles. You might spend 1-5 years working to get there, and by the time you reach your goal and get the great pension and benefits, you'll be so tired of the BS that it's time to leave.

review_title: I would go back for a full time job
pros:
Nice campus
Friendly helpful staff
Lots of professional development opportunities 
The students are energetic
Reasonable commute
Pension option for part time staff
cons:
Few full time opportunities
Staff have to pay for parking
In my role, part time staff are paid half of what the full timers make for the same job - not really fair

pros: Very relaxed atmosphere, fun team mates. Good chance to take a course on the side if you're on co-op. Gives you experience on how teaching would be like if you're pursuing that as a career.
cons: very slow at times, students don't usually come in for help. Some students expect you to do their homework which can get annoying a times.

pros: I loved the collective culture at this college.
cons: The new positions are often filled with connections. This can be good and it also leads to missed opportunities and sometimes nepotism. The job security is not so high.

pros: You work your minimum hours and nothing more. Expectations are low so you can put your effort into side projects.
cons: A silo'ed institution where there is a clear divide between "long timers" and those early in their career.

job_title: Corporate Support Function in Hamilton, ON
pros: One of the best employers you can work for in the region.  They treat their employees fairly.  Good salary and benefits.  Good culture.
cons: Too many part-time workers in faculty and admin waiting forever to get a full-time job.  This isn't only an issue with Mohawk, but it still impacts the culture.
